Marks on verso:
(handwritten label) in center: [Bought at a sale of the Hartley collection, Cheltenham, 24 October 1876. This collection belonged to an old lady who went out of her mind and __, pictures __ were sold by order of Lord Chancellor Sanders (Eryall Sanders) said these pictures belonged to Miss Hartley since 1815. --picture by Bronzino
CC Baillie
Charlton Kings
Gloucestershire]

label C: [Cheltenham: Hartley Collection (auction catalogue entry) 39: Charity: A female resting in a garden, a child is on her right, her arm thrown around him, his head playfully resting on it, another child on her left is climbing her knee; her face is turned toward a third boy above her shoulder, to whom she is holding up a bunch of grapes. On copper, signed: AL. AL It IS upon copper
This beautiful and highly finished cabinet picture was exhibited at the Leeds National Exhibition, 1868, See Official Catalogue, no. 277.]
title: Charity
